description: The local nickname conflicted with another nickname.

event.Summary: Local nickname conflict with another nickname

description: The local nickname conflict was cleared.
Trill system id.
variables.name: HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillSysID

description: Trill priority.
variables.name: HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillPriority

description: The alarm is generated if the device receives a PDU carrying an authentication password that is different from the local one. The PDU fragment is displayed in the alarm, helping network administrators locate the device that sent the PDU.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillAuthenticationFailure HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillSysInstance u 9999 HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillCircIfIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillPduFragment s EXAMPLE IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE

description: Trill instance id.
variables.name: HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillSysInstance

description: Trill circuit interface index.
variables.name: HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillCircIfIndex

description: 64-byte PDU fragment.
variables.name: HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillPduFragment

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: The alarm is generated if the device receives a PDU carrying an authentication mode that is different from the local one. The PDU fragment is displayed in the alarm, helping network administrators locate the device that sent the PDU.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillAuthenticationTypeFailure HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillSysInstance u 9999 HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillCircIfIndex i 9999 HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillPduFragment s EXAMPLE IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE

description: This object indicates that the Remaining Lifetime of a received LSP is less than 60s.

event.Summary: Remaining lifetime of received LSP less than 60s

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillLspRemainingLifetimeRefresh HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillInstanceID u 9999 IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillSysID s EXAMPL HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillPduLspId s EXAMPLEE HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillRemainingLifetime u 9999

description: Trill instance id.
variables.name: HUAWEI-TRILL-CONF-MIB::hwTrillInstanceID

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName
